intro: Euphrasia insignis var. iinumae, commonly known as the Japanese eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has delicate, hairy leaves that are opposite in arrangement and can reach up to 10 centimeters in length. Euphrasia insignis var. iinumae is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
